newsitem.title: KENYA: Kenya sells T-bills worth $95 million.
newsitem.headline: Kenya sells T-bills worth $95 million.

text.p: The Central Bank of Kenya sold Treasury bills worth 5.149 billion shillings ($95 million) at a weekly auction on Thursday, bank officials said.
The bank sold 91-day bills worth a total of 5.135 billion shillings at an average yield of 20.398 percent, compared with 7.434 billion shillings and 20.560 percent last week.
For 28-day bills, the bank sold 13 million shillings worth at an unchanged rate of 16.500 percent. Last week, it sold for 429 million shillings in the 28-day category.
The bank invited tenders for T-bills worth eight billion shillings for next week's Thursday auction.
